name: Location and exploration
description: A comparative look at location-based gaming and street art and how the way we experience these two art forms has moved out of traditional spaces and onto the street.

key_work.title: Pokémon GO
key_work.brief_description: Pokémon GO bridges the gap between the real world and the virtual world of Pokémon, with trainers across the globe discovering Pokémon out in the wild through augmented reality.

constellations_primary.name: Location and exploration
constellations_primary.description: A comparative look at location-based gaming and street art and how the way we experience these two art forms has moved out of traditional spaces and onto the street.

constellations_other.name: Location and exploration
constellations_other.description: A comparative look at location-based gaming and street art and how the way we experience these two art forms has moved out of traditional spaces and onto the street.

end.title: Exit Through the Gift Shop
end.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2010
end.brief_description: Exit Through the Gift Shop tells the incredible true story of how an eccentric French shop keeper turned documentary maker attempted to locate and befriend Banksy, only to have the artist turn the camera back on its owner.

constellations_other.name: Location and exploration
constellations_other.description: A comparative look at location-based gaming and street art and how the way we experience these two art forms has moved out of traditional spaces and onto the street.

links.description: By the time Banksy’s documentary Exit Through the Gift Shop was released in 2010, artists like Banksy and Invader had achieved cult-like status and exploring streets for their works had become a very common activity.

start.title: Wayfinder Live (2016)
start.brief_description: In 2016 Swinburne University developed a location-based game designed for councils to increase social connection. Users were rewarded with unlockable augmented/mixed reality artworks throughout Melbourne.

constellations_other.name: Location and exploration
constellations_other.description: A comparative look at location-based gaming and street art and how the way we experience these two art forms has moved out of traditional spaces and onto the street.

constellations_other.name: Location and exploration
constellations_other.description: A comparative look at location-based gaming and street art and how the way we experience these two art forms has moved out of traditional spaces and onto the street.

links.description: Wayfinder Live encourages users to explore the streets of their cities for discoveries in a similar to street artist Invader’s mosaic space invader works. Invader’s projects were captured in his self-made short documentary Art4Space.

start.title: Wayfinder Live (2016)
start.brief_description: In 2016 Swinburne University developed a location-based game designed for councils to increase social connection. Users were rewarded with unlockable augmented/mixed reality artworks throughout Melbourne.

constellations_other.name: Location and exploration
constellations_other.description: A comparative look at location-based gaming and street art and how the way we experience these two art forms has moved out of traditional spaces and onto the street.

end.title: The OA
end.brief_description: Prairie Johnson, blind as a child, comes home seven years after going missing with her sight restored. Some hail her a miracle, others a dangerous mystery, but Prairie won’t talk with the FBI or her parents about where she’s been.

constellations_other.name: Location and exploration
constellations_other.description: A comparative look at location-based gaming and street art and how the way we experience these two art forms has moved out of traditional spaces and onto the street.

links.description: The OA, created by Brit Marling and Zal Batmanglij, uses a fictitious game called Q Symphony, its development and its effect on users as a major storyline. Q Symphony is a location based game with mixed reality rewards, much like Wayfinder Live

start.title: Ingress (2013)
start.brief_description: Ingress (or Ingress Prime) is an augmented reality (AR) mobile game developed and published by Niantic for Android and iOS devices.

constellations_other.name: Location and exploration
constellations_other.description: A comparative look at location-based gaming and street art and how the way we experience these two art forms has moved out of traditional spaces and onto the street.

start.title: Pokémon GO
start.brief_description: Pokémon GO bridges the gap between the real world and the virtual world of Pokémon, with trainers across the globe discovering Pokémon out in the wild through augmented reality.

constellations_primary.name: Location and exploration
constellations_primary.description: A comparative look at location-based gaming and street art and how the way we experience these two art forms has moved out of traditional spaces and onto the street.

end.title: Ingress (2013)
end.brief_description: Ingress (or Ingress Prime) is an augmented reality (AR) mobile game developed and published by Niantic for Android and iOS devices.

constellations_other.name: Location and exploration
constellations_other.description: A comparative look at location-based gaming and street art and how the way we experience these two art forms has moved out of traditional spaces and onto the street.

links.description: Prior to Pokémon Go’s launch in 2016, game developer Niantic had released another location-based game, Ingress. A lot of the real-world information used for Pokémon Go was repurposed from this game.
